notes:
Round 1 - Getting Started

So you want to to become a machine gun? This is how it starts.

It's orbin time - this is your main power yoy have to get early. Due to the the low health of enemies, in the early game 8 orbs can absolutely melt squishies. However be careful when charging as early on it can take 3/5 longer than usual to fully charge your secondary fire.

Weapon grease - This is your most important perk, we want to build up our attack speed as quickly as we possibly can to reduce charge up time on secondary fire and to apply constant pressure to the enemies with primary fire.

Power playback- This is important for giving that extra bit of healing to your tank early in the game while we have no other powers to support us with healing.

Playstyle -
Surviving is your best friend here. Play back with your dps to allow them to peel if you get dived and try and look for opportunities to pick of squishies when possible. From now until round 7 we want to be keeping our harmony orb on the tank as much as possible to give them constant healing and letting our other support help heal the DPS.

Round 2 - speeding things up

Now we are putting all of our cash into our attack speed to start to do more constant pressure and keep ourselves alive vs aggressive tanks and dives.

Wrist wraps - wrist wraps is blessing us with some ability power and attack speed. This is a must have in the early game as keeping your tank up will become increasingly more difficult in round 2.

Aftermarket firing pin - this allows us to build up our attack speed even more and also grants us a small amount fo movement speed making a slow hero like zen more versatile in team fights.

Playstyle - 
This is where the fun begins. You will often see in round 2 people feeling much more confident, and sometimes too confident. The plan this round is to play slightly more aggressive and to apply constant pressure to the enemies. However with our increased attack speed look to punish anybody who makes a mistake or over-extends. Your pure speed will either kill them or put them down low enough for someone else to finish them easily. We are looking to show to enemies that the slightest mistake versus you will end them.up back in the spawn room.

Round 3 - the healing sentry 

This is where this build begins to show its true power.

Power - enlightenment
This is our key to winning the game. This power turns 35% of our damage done into extra healing for our harmony orb target. With our insane amount of attack speed, we can give consistent healing to our team (but especially our tank) just by doing damage to the enemy team, allowing our tank to stay alive whilst cycling their cool downs.

Volskaya Ordnance - everything has more health than zenyata with how much of a glass canon he is. So taking this perk allows us to capitalise on that. This is especially important if you see the enemy tank going for a high health build as we can start doing insane amount of damage to them in a very short amount of time.

Extra money? No problem! -
If you find that you have had a good first few rounds and have some money to spare I would recommend ammo reserves or weapon grease. Base it off of how the game is going. But extra ammo can be very helpful in reducing the amount of times that you need to reload.

Playstyle -
Now we are getting into the nitty gritty of this build. You need to start being confident in your ability and aim and playing aggressive. We need to punish anyone out of position or who is vulnerable and make sure that we are doing consistent damage to the tank to keep them from getting any space. Keep your harmony orb on your tank and keep them alive because remember, any damage you do will be transfered into healing and more than likely the tank is going to need that more than the DPS. Your other support should be powefull enough to keep your dps alive and healed so they can continue to deal out damage along side you.

Round 4 - Machine Gun Kelly
Now we are staring to get very strong so expect resistance from the enemies.

Booster Jets - 20% attack speed. Need I say more?

Icy coolant - this is a good alternative for compensator if you have the cash to do it. It gives you that extra 5% weapon power which will make a difference I'm the amount of damage and healing you do and can be a big help to healing keep your tank alive.

Playstyle -
Your are now reaching your potential. We have a massive amount of attack speed and have the potential to cause a lot of havoc to the enemy team. We are playing a lot how we did before with punishing out of positioned players but we should expect resistance now after our last round. We should keep an eye out for reapers and genjis trying to pick us of and it is imperative that you are ready and are watching their cooldowns as much as you possibly can.

Reaper - reaper is fairly easy to deal with, try and keep him at a distance and if you can get a charged secondary fire on him when he attempts to dive then it will force him to wraith away leaving you a nice window to continue with you machine gun duties! If he finishes his wraith in a bad position then he immediately should be become a priority target for you as taking a reaper out of the equation can help keep your backing safe.

Genji - he is harder to deal with. Try and pepper shots into him where possible. ONLY USE A CHARGED SHOT WHEN YOU KNOW HE HAS NO DEFLECT. Zens charged shots are fairly easy to predict and so only use them when you know the genji can't send them straight back to you.

Round 5 - adapting your strategy
Here is where you can start to deviate from the pathway a bit depending on what your team needs.

Power - Seeking Salvation 
This is my personal favourite and my recommendation for this build. This allows yoy to follow up on your damage very easily and finish off kills that are retreating or trying to get away. The homing secondary fires are also great as because of how quickly they charge they are a reliable finishing tool for kills.

Gotta have faith - 
This is also a strong pick if you are playing with a dive tank such as diva as it means you can continue to heal her for longer as she is going for dives without you having to chase her down in order to keep her in your LOS

Three tap tommy-gun -
This gives you attack speed and ability power that can be very useful for increased healing. It also continues to build up your attack speed making you even more dangerous.

Salvaged slugs - 
This is also a viable option instead of three tap tommy-gun if you are playing against any sort of shield tank. It can be great to help breakdown tanks protection and get access to their backline.

Playstyle -
This depends on which power you went for but if you did go for Seeking salvation, don't be afraid to peek corners to finish of kills, keep your aggression and keep the pressure on and your on your way to winning, however keep a eye out for those dive heroes as you don't want to be caught out of position this late in the game

Round 6 - Fully automatic Robot
Now we are at full potential of this build. We are melting squishies and destroying tanks like it's a walk in the park whilst keeping our team alive. It'd tike to show your true power.

Haste Subroutine -
This is your secret weapon, every person with a discord orb on them is in danger. Your secondary fire will shoot like bullets across the screen giving the enemy no time to react to your shots cresting easy kill opportunities. Make sure to focus down your discord targets and switch to the next to get the full use put of this perk.

Code breaker - most enemies will have shield by now and so this is allways usefull for doing that extra bit of damage to the enemy team.

If you can afford eye of the spider take it, it will boost your damage by 10 fold.

Playstyle -
You are dangerous, and a high priority target, be critical and punsih anyone who steps out of line. Play close to your team to allow them to peel for you and use your transference either selfishly or for a big ultimate such as death blossom. The lo ger your alive the more of a threat you are.

Round 7 - ultimate transcendence
You are a mean keen killing machine and nobody can stop you now.

Powers - instant karma or inner peace
These powers are completely interchangeable and can be used dependant on your game so far. The main use of these is just to try and keep you alive longer and to help you in 1v1s

Commanders clip -
This is the cherry on the cake. This gives you 40% extra ammo which allows you more consistency and less downtime which is great for all situations, just keep an eye in your ammo to make sure you don't get stuck in a situation where you think you have more ammo than you do.

Playstyle -
Kill them all. Your tank will be getting lots of healing and if you made it to round 7 you are basically a threat to anyone you can see. Don't be overconfident and get into bad positions but don't be afraid to take 1v1s and take down enemy DPS with your fire rate. Have fun gunning the enemy down without any mercy and a loverly little play of the game to finish things off.
